What is the task when listening to statements about a picture?
The task when listening to statements about a picture is to determine whether the statement accurately describes the content of the picture or not.
Where should I mark my answers during the test?

You should mark your answers on the answer sheet provided by the examiner. Make sure to carefully read and understand each question before selecting your answer. If you are unsure about any question, it is best to leave it blank and move on to the next one.

Summarize this text:  Months year. It is still winter when February comes. They say that March comes in like a lion and goes out like a lamb. That means that it is still usually cold and sometimes stormy when March begins. By the time that March ends, the weather is starting to get a little better. April is the rainy month. April showers, spring, May flowers. Many of the spring flowers bloom in May. The weather can be quite mild in May. June is usually a nice warm month. Many people get married in June. July can be hot. People have vacations in July. It is a month to do summer things. It is still summer in August, but the summer is winding down. August is the time to have last minute vacations. In September we go back to school. The autumn winds begin to blow. October really feels like autumn. October is Halloween time. November is when we really start to feel the chill. December is the Christmas month. Most people do a lot of Christmas shopping in December. They spend quite a bit of time getting ready for Christmas. All of the months are different. Which month were you born in?

The text describes the weather and activities associated with each month from February to August. It also mentions holidays and events such as Valentine's Day, Easter, weddings, vacations, and Halloween. The text concludes by noting that December is the Christmas month. The author does not provide any information about which month the reader was born in.
What does the phrase "March comes in like a lion and goes out like a lamb" mean?

The phrase "March comes in like a lion and goes out like a lamb" is an idiom that means that March is often cold and sometimes stormy at the beginning, but by the end of the month, the weather starts to improve. This expression is used to describe the transition from winter to spring.
Which month is described as the "rainy month"?
The text mentions that April is the "rainy month."
What is significant about the month of June?
According to the text, June is a significant month because it is usually a nice warm month and many people get married in that month.
What happens in September?

The text does not mention anything specific about September. However, it's worth noting that September is typically associated with the start of the school year in many countries, as well as the beginning of fall or autumn.
Why is December referred to as the "Christmas month"?

December is referred to as the "Christmas month" because it is traditionally the time when Christians celebrate Christmas, a major holiday commemorating the birth of Jesus Christ. The festivities often include gift-giving, feasting, and exchanging greeting cards. Additionally, many people take time off work during this month to spend time with their families and friends.
